name: electrode production, positive, LaNi5 | electrode, positive, LaNi5 | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2904/documentation

This dataset represents 1 kg of the positive LaNi5 electrode material for the production of NiMH batteries. Main data are taken from an environmental report of a battery producer as well as from literature. In addition own measurements of sizes and weights of batteries were used. It is based on a density of 8310 kg/m3 for LaNi5 the total mass of LaNi5 per kg NiMH rechargable battery package of 0.3348 kg LaNi5 electrode is determined as: 0.10781 m*0.08181 m*0.00015 m*8310 kg/m3*18 = 0.1979 kg LaNi5 / NiMH battery package;  0.1979 kg*1 kg / 0.591 kg = 0.3348 kg LaNi5 / kg NiMH battery package.;The following assumptions are made to approximate the infrastructure demand per kg LaNi5 electrode:;-> LaNi5 content per battery package:	0.3348 kg/kg NiMH battery package;-> Life time of the HITACHI Kyoto plant (own assumption):	50 years;-> Total battery package production capacity assumption for Kyoto in 2003 (own assumption):	1/3;-> Total NiMH battery package production capacity for Kyoto in 2003 (approx. from Fig.2):	0.4;-> Total consolidated net sales of batteries in 2003 (MAXELL (2003)):	65'532'000'000 ¥;-> Average price of a NiMH laptop battery package in 2006 :	98.89 £;-> Currency course ¥ <>CHF (exchange rate at Aug 25, 2006):	100 ¥ = 1.11 CHF;-> Currency course £ <> CHF (exchange rate at Oct 12, 2006):	1 £ = 2.44 CHF;The calculation is then performed as follows:;<- Single price of NiMH  rechargable battery:	91.89 £ = 224.44 CHF;<- Conversion of consolidated net sales:	65'532'000'000 ¥ = 727'405'200 CHF;<- NiMH revenue fraction: 	727'405'200 CHF * (1/3) * 0.4 = 96’987’360 CHF;<- Annual NiMH battery package production:  	;	96’987’360 CHF / 224.44 CHF = 432’130 NiMH battery package/year;<- Annual LaNi5 electrode production: ;	432’130 electrodes /year * 0.3348 kg LaNi5 = 144’696 kg LaNi5 / kg NiMH battery package;<- Infrastructure demand per kg LaNi5 electrode:;	1 plant/ (144’696 kgLaNi5 electrode /year * 50 years) = 1.3822e-7 plants/kg LaNi5;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of raw materials at the factory gate.

This dataset includes (Raw) materials, transport efforts and energy consumption for the production of the positive electrode for NiMH batteries. Neither waste nor emissions to air or water are taken into account.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This module relates to the global situation (electricity consumption according to the main producing countries).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Construction details as described for NiMH-rechargable batteries and manufacturing conditions as documented in the environmental report were adopted.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
The battery package consists of only one large sized battery cell. Technologically a battery cell consists of a multilayered assembly of coats sandwiched to each other and wound eiter circular or prismatically around a virtual axis. The size of this wound layer assembly is specified based on approximations for single cell layer assembly as contained in a LiIo rechargable battery.
The mass of the entire multilayer cell assembly of the considered reference NiMH rechargable battery package is approximated based upon size approximations for the above noted LiIo battery model and is made as follows:
Cell layer assembly length (LiIo rechargable battery): 100.00 mm
Cell layer assembly width (LiIo rechargable battery):	60.00 mm
Battery length (LiIo rechargable battery):	128.00 mm
Battery width (LiIo rechargable battery):	77.00 mm
Battery length (NiMH rechargable battery): 138.00 mm
The calculation is then performed as follows:
Cell layer assembly length (NiMH rechargable battery):
100.00 mm / 128.00 mm = 78.125%
138.00 mm *0.781 = 107.81 mm
 Cell layer assembly width (NiMH rechargable battery):
60.00 mm / 77.00 mm = 77.922%
105.00 mm *0.779 = 81.81 mm 
The thickness (i.e. the depth) of the single unwound layer compartments is approximated with 0.15 mm. Accordingly the single layers are dimensioned as follows (W x D x H): 81.81 mm x 0.15 mm x 107.81 mm.
A multilayer package consists of 5 individual layers, namely positive and negative electrode, separator and electrolyte layer. The thickness of the entire prismatically wound multilayer assembly is approximated to 13.5 mm. Adopting the above defined thickness for a single layer (0.15 mm), the entire prismatically wound multilayer assembly consists in total of 90 individual layers and 18 windings (with each time 5 individual layers).
